definition: lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
Ying, ancient capital of Chu 楚 in Hubei, Jianling county 江陵縣|江陵县
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
swallow (family Hirundinidae)/old variant of 宴[yan4]
variant of 燕[yan4]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
to pass on errors or lies (idiom); the propagation of misconceptions
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
perfectly sound proposition/unalterable truth/irrefutable argument
dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
indisputable statement/unalterable truth
modern people
fool/stupid person
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
